reviewText: I purchased this product for my dad as a gift. He loves nature, especially predators like lions, leopards, cheetahs, etc. And, so with reading the reviews, my father said that it shown a clip of cheetahs and lions fighting ferociously for 15 minutes, then it switches to another scene which does not involve lions and cheetahs. And, the same scene between the lions and cheetahs seem to continuously repeat itself over and over again. My father sent the DVD back to me, I will be returning it once I receive the DVD from my dad.

I'll state right off, this is probably not best for young children. When the National Geographic cameras captured this most unusual occurrence on the African savannah, it not only earned an hour long episode, but really required the experts to come in and break it down frame by frame. Agree or not with their opinions of the events as they occur, you will inevitably see raw life. If you want to watch what happens when two of Africa's top feline predators are forced into conflict, speed verses power, there will be only one true victor .
